reg:regulation.reg:title:
Rule 71-801
Implementing the Multijurisdictional Disclosure System Under
National Instrument 71-101
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 106/2016, May 9, 2016]

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: NI 41-101 means National Instrument 41-101 General Prospectus Requirements,
NI 71-101 means National Instrument 71-101 entitled "The Multijurisdictional Disclosure System",
a term that is defined or interpreted in the Act has the meaning ascribed to it in the Act,
a term that is defined or interpreted in Part 1 of NI 71-101 has the meaning ascribed to it in that Part,
a term that is defined or interpreted in National Instrument 14-101 entitled "Definitions" has the meaning ascribed to it in that Instrument, and
a term that is defined or interpreted in NI 62-104 has the meaning ascribed to it in that Instrument.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The exemptions established under this Rule are in addition to those established under NI 71-101.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Preliminary MJDS prospectus and MJDS prospectus
bcl:section.bcl:text: NI 41-101 does not apply to a distribution of securities made by MJDS prospectus in compliance with NI 71-101 if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for a distribution of a preliminary prospectus, the dealer complies with section 16 (1) (a) of NI 41-101, and
in connection with the lapse date of a prospectus under section 17.2 of NI 41-101, the distribution of securities under an MJDS prospectus is in relation to a rule 415 offering.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Bids for Securities of U.S. Issuers

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of the regulations to bids

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the following provisions of NI 62-104 do not apply to a bid made in compliance with Part 12 of NI 71-101:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 2.4 and 2.5, unless 20% or more of each class of securities that is subject to the bid is held by persons whose last address as shown on the books of the issuer is in Canada, as determined in accordance with subsections 12.1 (2), (3) and (4) of NI 71-101,

section 2.8, but only to the extent that the offeror need not deliver the bid to holders of securities that, before the expiry of the bid, are convertible into securities of the class that is subject to the bid and whose last address as shown on the books of the offeree issuer is in British Columbia, and
the requirement in subsection 2.10 (1) that a bid circular be in the required form.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), an offeror under a bid must file a copy of any bid circular, notice of change, and notice of variation on the day the bid circular, notice of change or notice of variation, as applicable, is sent, or as soon as practicable after that.

bcl:section.bcl:hnote: [en. B.C. Reg. 21/2008, Sch. D. s. 2; am. B.C. Reg. 106/2016, Sch. G, ss. 4 to 6.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of the Act and NI 62-104 in respect of MJDS directors' circulars and MJDS individual director's or officer's circulars

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the following provisions of the Act and NI 62-104 do not apply to directors or individual directors or officers that elect to comply with U.S. federal securities law under Part 12 of NI 71-101 in preparing a directors' circular or individual director's or officer's circular in relation to a take-over bid made for securities of the offeree issuer under Part 12 of NI 71-101:

Despite subsection (1), a director and an individual director or officer must file a copy of any directors' circular, individual director's or officer's circular, notice of change, and notice of variation on the day the circular, notice of change or notice of variation, as applicable, is sent, or as soon as practicable after that.

bcl:section.bcl:hnote: [en. B.C. Reg. 21/2008, Sch. D s. 2; am. B.C. Reg. 106/2016, Sch. G, ss. 7 and 8.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Filing and sending of financial statements
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following provisions of the Securities Rules do not apply to a U.S. issuer that has a class of securities registered under section 12 of the 1934 Act or is required to file reports under section 15 (d) of the 1934 Act and is in compliance with that requirement:
